pullRequest.title: Introduce CacheQuotaRequirementProvider
pullRequest.bodyText:
== NO RELEASE NOTE ==

Depended by facebookexternal/presto-facebook#1047
Depends on facebookexternal/presto-facebook#1047

nodes.bodyText: I don't think we need to send provider around?
nit: you could get this String by creating SchemaTableName and using SchemaTableName#toString

+package com.facebook.presto.hive;
+
+public class CacheQuotaUtil
+{
+    private CacheQuotaUtil() {}
+
+    public static final String GLOBAL_PATH = ".";
+
+    public static String completeTablePath(String schema, String table)

nodes.bodyText:
This function signature seems to be a bit conflict with the javadoc above, which mentions we could get quota on partition scope. Since we don't want to compute it for every split, the easiest way to move forward is to add comment here saying we don't support different partition quota within one table.
Of course we could return a map or make CacheQuotaRequirement to be more sophisticated, but let's start with something simple.

+
+public interface CacheQuotaProvider
+{
+    /**
+     * @return corresponding quota for specific schema, table, and partition
+     * @param schema
+     * @param table
+     *
+     */
+    CacheQuotaRequirement getCacheQuota(String schema, String table);

nodes.bodyText: I don't see this class being used in open source. Maybe we should move this to where it resides?

nit: Cache quota requirement for given schema and table?

nodes.bodyText: Actually maybe we should name this CacheQuotaRequirementProvider? We already have a CacheQuota class, so maybe not make it more confusing.

+
+public interface CacheQuotaRequirementProvider
+{
+    /**
+     * @return cache quota requirement for a given schema and table
+     *
+     * @param schema
+     * @param table

+    CacheQuotaRequirement getCacheQuota(String schema, String table);
